title: How to Save Pictures from Emails on an iPhone + Quick Fixes

steps.title: Tap the email message.
steps.content: Tap the email message. This will open it fully. You should see the picture within the email body. This method will work in iOS' Mail app, Gmail app, or another email app. If you don't see the picture in the Mail app, make sure you don't have Privacy Protection turned on. To check, open Settings → Mail → Privacy Protection → toggle off Protect Mail Activity . [2] X Research source

steps.title: Tap and hold the photo.
steps.content: Tap and hold the photo. A pop-up menu will open. [3] X Research source

steps.title: Tap Save Image.
steps.content: Tap Save Image . You can find this in the pop-up menu, under Markup and Reply . [4] X Research source The picture will be saved to your iPhone. You can find it in the Photos app. Alternatively, you can select Save to Files to save the picture to the Files app or iCloud .

steps.title: Take a screenshot instead.
steps.content: Take a screenshot instead. If you can't save a picture to your Camera Roll, it may have protections enabled or it's in a file that can't be saved. In this case, you can screenshot the picture . Keep in mind this will affect the size and resolution of the image. [5] X Research source On iPhones without a Home button: press the lock button and top volume button at the same time. On iPhones with a Home button, press the lock button and Home button at the same time.

steps.title: Clear some space.
steps.content: Clear some space. If you don't have enough storage space on your iPhone, you may be unable to save new pictures. Consider using a cloud service such as iCloud or Google Drive to store media. [6] X Research source
